hanzi-su-wiki:
萎

Значения

Вянуть, сохнуть, падать духом

Мнемоника

Дряхлому мужчине можно поручать 委 лишь заготовку травы 艹.
purpleculture_pinyin:
wěi
to wither; to drop; to decline; spiritless; Taiwan pr. [wei1]
увядать; уронить; снижаться; бездуховный; Тайвань пр. [wei1]
rtega_mnemonic:
萎萎RSwither, wilt, ill, sick, fall, weaken
  • plants 艹 after women have harvested grain 委: weakened and withered
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 委 indicates the sound; 艹 (plant) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
萎缩 [ wěi suō ]: to wither; to dry up (of a plant); to atrophy (of muscle, social custom etc)
枯萎 [ kū wěi ]: to wilt; to wither; wilted; withered; drained; enervated; exhausted
萎靡 [ wěi mǐ ]: dispirited; depressed
萎靡不振 [ wěi mǐ bù zhèn ]: dispirited and listless (idiom); downcast
阳萎 [ yáng wěi ]: impotence; also written 阳痿
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 艹 [ cǎo ] grass, weed, plant, herb
    • 委 [ wěi ] to appoint, to commission, to send
heisig_chinese_memo: A committee forms for preventing the early wilting of flowers. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: numb, flowers, committee, wheat, cereal, woman
koohiiStory1: Oh, the committee´s in for a surprise: I put some nightshades into their drinks. They´ll be numb for sure, probably worse.
koohiiStory2: The keyword numb makes no sense. I choose 萎む（しぼむ）"to fade away". A girl lies in a wheat field at the same time every day. A photo is taken every day showing this scene and a time lapse video shows the wheat growing through the year until the wheat is tall and the top sprouts to look like its flowers. At this point, the girl can no longer be seen in the photos and she fades away.
kunYomi: な、しお.れる、しな.びる、しぼ.む、な.える
jp_example_words:
萎びる(しなびる): to wilt, to fade
萎む(しぼむ): to wither, to fade (away), to shrivel, to wilt
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the grass (艹) you entrust (委) loses strength
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A committee forms for preventing the early wilting of flowers. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From "艸" to " Wei " sound. "Suo Wen" is based on the original meaning of feeding cattle and horses. "Shuowen": "Withering, eating cows. Congchou, Weisheng." Duan Yucai's note: "Below it is said that "with the grain wilting the horse", the cow and the horse will "wither"."

" Wilt " said that they withered vegetation. Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Gu Feng": "No grass will not die, no wood will not wither." "Selected Works. "Shen Xiuwen" "Sheng Er Cheng Pian on March 3rd": "Ning recalls that the silkworms rise in spring, and the mulberry is dying at sunset." Tang Dynasty Bai Juyi "Reading Hanshu": "Peaches, plums and thorns, the frost falls at the same night."

" Withering " is a metaphor for people's lack of energy, like plants withered. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. "Nine Debates": "Leaving the Fang Ain’s Fang Zhuang Xi, the rest of the contract and sorrow." Wang Yi's note: "The body is exhausted and poor." It also refers to a person who is seriously ill and will die, such as "Book of Rites. "On Tan Gong": "Taishan is decayed, beams are bad, and philosophers are withered!"
humanum_short_description_en: From "艸" to " Wei " sound. "Suo Wen" is based on the original meaning of feeding cattle and horses.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「委」聲。《說文》以為本義是餵養牛馬。《說文》：「萎，食牛也。从艸，委聲。」段玉裁注：「下文云『以穀萎馬』，則牛馬通偁『萎』。」

　　「萎」多表示草木枯死。如《詩．小雅．谷風》：「無草不死，無木不萎。」《文選．沈休文〈三月三日率爾成篇〉》：「寧憶春蠶起，日暮桑欲萎。」唐代白居易〈讀漢書〉：「桃李與荊棘，霜降同夜萎。」

　　「萎」比喻人精神不振，像植物枯槁。如《楚辭．九辯》：「離芳藹之方壯兮，余萎約而悲愁。」王逸注：「身體疲病而憂貧也。」又指人病重、將死，如《禮記．檀弓上》：「泰山其頹乎，梁木其壞乎，哲人其萎乎！」
humanum_short_description: 從「艸」，「委」聲。《說文》以為本義是餵養牛馬。

從「 艸 」，「 委 」聲。《說文》以為本義是餵養牛馬。《說文》：「萎，食牛也。从艸，委聲。」段玉裁注：「下文云『以穀萎馬』，則牛馬通偁『萎』。」 「 萎 」多表示草木枯死。如《詩．小雅．谷風》：「無草不死，無木不萎。」《文選．沈休文〈三月三日率爾成篇〉》：「寧憶春蠶起，日暮桑欲萎。」唐代白居易〈讀漢書〉：「桃李與荊棘，霜降同夜萎。」 「 萎 」比喻人精神不振，像植物枯槁。如《楚辭．九辯》：「離芳藹之方壯兮，余萎約而悲愁。」王逸注：「身體疲病而憂貧也。」又指人病重、將死，如《禮記．檀弓上》：「泰山其頹乎，梁木其壞乎，哲人其萎乎！」
From " 艸" to " Wei" sound. "Suo Wen" is based on the original meaning of feeding cattle and horses. "Shuowen": "Withering, eating cows. Congchou, Weisheng." Duan Yucai's note: "Below it is said that "with the grain wilting the horse", the cow and the horse will "wither"." " Wilt" said that they withered vegetation. Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Gu Feng": "No grass will not die, no wood will not wither." "Selected Works. "Shen Xiuwen" "Sheng Er Cheng Pian on March 3rd": "Ning recalls that the silkworms rise in spring, and the mulberry is dying at sunset." Tang Dynasty Bai Juyi "Reading Hanshu": "Peaches, plums and thorns, the frost falls at the same night." " Withering" is a metaphor for people's lack of energy, like plants withered. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. "Nine Debates": "Leaving the Fang Ain’s Fang Zhuang Xi, the rest of the contract and sorrow." Wang Yi's note: "The body is exhausted and poor." It also refers to a person who is seriously ill and will die, such as "Book of Rites. "On Tan Gong": "Taishan is decayed, beams are bad, and philosophers are withered!"

wěi
1) засыхать, вянуть, сохнуть, высыхать
无木不萎 нет деревьев, которые бы не засыхали
2) хиреть, хворать, заболевать
哲人其萎乎 О, и хиреет великий мудрец!
3) wěi, разг. wēi приходить в упадок, спускаться, падать, снижаться
买卖萎了 торговля пришла в упадок
价钱萎下来了 цены упали
